intro: Dimorphanthera keysseri, commonly known as the Red-flowered Orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red petals and a unique, intricate floral structure that attracts specific pollinators. Its leaves are elongated and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its colorful blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dimorphanthera keysseri is considered a conservation concern.
